profile_positions.description:
Karachaganak is an onshore supergiant gas-condensate field  with 650mill cft/d of gas and 200,000 bbl/d oil production from Carboniferous and Permian Carbonates in 5000 m TVDSS with approx 50TcF of GIIP, developed by deviated producers with partly smart completion by means of acid stimulation and induced fractures. Clients are amongst others Russia, Europe, Turkey. The JV KPO (Karachaganak Petroleum Oil Company) is operated by Shell and ENI; LukOil, KazMunaiGas and Chevron are additional Parent Companies.

Leading the PP section supporting well planning, execution, well intervention&monitoring, and static &dynamic model building; Line management of team members; long term Shell Technical Authority; Shell global SME for QI-Petrophysics (incl. 3D & 4D seismic); coach and lecturer for junior PP-staff; several focal point activities, e.g. contracting, geomechanics
